The claim is based on President Obama: s statement during the 2012 presidential debate that Mitt Romney's Medicare plan would turn it into a voucher program.
PolitiFact has previously found Obama: s characterization of the plan as a "voucher" reasonable, although Republicans prefer to call it "premium support."
The Merriam: Webster definition of a voucher aligns with the concept of a subsidy or credit for future purchases, which is similar to how Romney's Medicare plan would work.
Romney: s running mate, Paul Ryan, has presented and revised his Medicare reform ideas, with Romney indicating agreement with Ryan's most recent plan. Under this plan, beneficiaries would have the choice of receiving a fixed subsidy from the government to use for private insurance or a plan similar to traditional Medicare.
